column3: You'll need to wait for #15085 to be merged first. Then you can create a proper backport commit, (see [this script](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools/blob/master/backport.py) for help) which has the correct `Github-Pull`, `Rebased-From` info in the commit body. See #15002 for an example.
> You'll need to wait for #15085 to be merged first\n\n@fanquake didn't wait in #15002 :trollface:
@benthecarman You can still use this PR though. You should be able to force push to the existing branch once 15085 is merged üëç.
@benthecarman Could you now turn this into a proper backporting commit?
There is a script to do that: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools#backport

I don't think this warrants a separate backport PR. I think it's better to group these small changes, and leave separate backport PR for difficult changes that are significantly different between branches.

That said utACK 59dd855d2de77cd72a2b3190a825783ff3627e17 for this time.
